title: WebStandardsAwards.com
body: <a href="http://www.webstandardsawards.com/">WebStandardsAwards.com</a> - I agree with most of their picks, but the two that really stuck out are: <a href="http://www.gedimo.lt/">gedimo.lt</a> and <a href="http://www.frozentoast.com/">frozentoast.com</a>.  Both sites are beautiful, have decent source, do not render in quirks mode, are standards compliant, AND neither contain useless flash movies.  They work in <a href="http://www.microsoft.com/windows/ie/default.asp?TNN" title="TNN: The New Netscape"><acronym title="The New Netscape">tnn</acronym></a>, but obviously look better in a <a title="real browser" href="http://www.mozilla.org/products/firefox" >real browser</a>.
